title: Sanctions Will Hurt Russia but Are Unlikely to Deter Its Aggression in Ukraine
sub_head: Economic sanctions have struggled to change the behavior of authoritarian leaders from Iran to Venezuela
body:
Western nations have in the past week imposed the most sweeping economic sanctions against a major country in recent decades, moves that are likely to cripple the Russian economy and sharply raise the costs of the countryâ€™s invasion of Ukraine.
Whether it will be enough to cause Russian President Vladimir Putin to withdraw his troops from Ukraine, or even weaken his hold on power, however, is far less likely, according to experts on sanctions.
